website_summaries.verdict: Runs efficiently and keeps a steady flame in poor weather and high altitude, although some buyers had issues with the quality of the build.
pros: Uses PerfectHeat and PerfectFlow technologies for efficient and even cooking
Screws onto a propane canister, and provides 10,000 BTUs of cooking power
Baffles offer protection from the wind
Weight of the stove and canister is just under 3.5 pounds
Boils a quart of water in 4 minutes
cons: Some reports of quality issues involving the plastic parts (break easily) and the screw threads (poor metal, strips easily)
can't adjust it low enough to prevent burning

customer_reviews.title: works well wish it have i
customer_reviews.text: works petty well for the money. I found a good carrying case for it. Sterilite Ez carry plastic container 9.5x8x6.8. I got it from target but you can get it pretty much anywhere from $4-$5. fits the stove and base by itself perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Geniv

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Compact. Lightweight. Super simple to attach to the propane tank. Burns evenly. Does well in windy situations. Perfect for camping.
customer_reviews.author: Tonie

customer_reviews.title: I used this for 7 days straight through 4 national parks
customer_reviews.text: this may be a little bit bigger than other portable ultra light camping stoves but now that i have used it, i wouldn't want anything else. the one thing i read about the ultra lights, is that the overall area to place a pot/pan on is small and can be flimsy, so i purchased this guy. it held all of my camping pots/pans perfectly, and since you slide the bottle of gas into the round base, you can adjust it if you are on a little bit of a slope. loved this and will be a staple for future camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Leonard

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 1 year, then gas leak and flames from the knob
customer_reviews.text: It worked fine for the first year. Then suddenly started leaking gas from the adjuster knob and would burst into flames as you can see from the melted plastic and burn marks in the picture. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren & Chris Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great camp stove alternative
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a two-night camping trip with my daughter and it worked great. It can be a little tippy if your pan is too large, so take that into account before ordering. But we used it with a fry pan, a pot to boil water and a package of stove-top popcorn and had no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Not stable at all
customer_reviews.text: Placed a pan on the stove and while heating onions I prepared to add the pepers to make fajitas. The hot glue on the bottom of the Coleman propane canister let loose and the whole thing tipped over, spilling the food on the ground. I stood it up and started over. The burner is chrome plated and the pans slide very easily if the burner is slightly off level. This seems too dangerous to be something I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Brunt

customer_reviews.title: Hit and miss
customer_reviews.text: Easy enough to set up and burns a nice even flame. Two major drawbacks: 1) The lowest setting before the flame goes out is still too high for some cooking. Would be nice to have an even lower setting for simmering. 2) It would be nice to be able to adjust the burner up and down relative to the stand. The problem is that it sits VERY close to your pot and combined with problem (1) above, you get a superhot spot in the middle of your pot rather than a more diffuse flame evenly distributing the heat. Fine for boiling water, but for cooking food at something other than full blast, it's hard to control.
customer_reviews.author: Mark my Words

customer_reviews.title: Small, compact, portable
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a small camping burner, the this one met my expectations for cooking in a small pot and small pan. Cooked eggs, beans, sausage, boiled water.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy and stable
customer_reviews.text: I got this in a pinch for camping with the kids. Use a heavy pan, not a cheap lightweight one. I used a stainless pan but a skillet would probably be even better. It takes a little practice to get the heat just right but I was able to whip together a pound of bacon, hash browns, eggs and pancakes at the picnic table before the wife and kids dragged themselves out of the tent. This is probably one of the best space saving camping tools. Even if you need two burners, 2 of these are cheaper, easier and more compact than almost any worthwhile campstove.
customer_reviews.author: otterpopdotorg

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight camping stove, needs better gas control
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a portable camping stove. Very light weight and puts out good heat. My only issue is that there is no throttling. You either open it all the way or it shuts off. Regardless of how little wind there is, I even tried it inside a cabin, as soon as you turn it one notch below fully on, it shuts off. If they fixed that I would give it five stars because it's cheap, light weight and works well
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Deadly
customer_reviews.text: If u go on youtube, you may think you can hook this to a 15 lb tank w/ a hose. Then, as you research further, u hear stories that the hose over heats and disconnects. You are lucky if you do not blow up. I contacted Coleman on FaceBook and they said this can "only be used w/ 1 LB canisters.
customer_reviews.author: T.O..

customer_reviews.title: Great little stove
customer_reviews.text: I truly like this little stove, it weighs less than the bottle of propane but is very sturdy. You need to be sure to place your cookware on the middle of it of course but it's well balanced and I've had no issues with it! This would be a great gift for anyone who enjoys hiking or backpacking or for camping! Mine works very well and has already seen a good deal of use. It is from my favorite camping supplier Coleman whom I've trusted for years for outfitting my camping/hiking needs!
customer_reviews.author: NEA Sound

customer_reviews.title: Can not be turned down to a low burn, burns TOO HOT !
customer_reviews.text: Does work well if all you want to do is boil water and fast, lowest setting is way too hot to do reasonable cooking or even to perk coffee, unit is stable enough and strong enough, however I had to hold pans and coffee peculator pot about four inches above flame for proper heat (not exactly a safe way to cook) If flame adjustment could be turned down half of lowest setting it would be perfect ! I tried calling customer service for assistance, the young lady I spoke with knew less than me about the product or it's operation.
customer_reviews.author: PaPa

customer_reviews.title: A great stove for car camping.
customer_reviews.text: Though not one of the smallest, this is by far one of the handiest portable stoves. At 10000 BTU it really cranks out the heat. Easy to assemble and use. Dial can be a tad finicky but otherwise a pleasure to use. Care should be taken when placing cooking pans onto burner as it is not as grippy as It should be. Otherwise a great stove.
customer_reviews.author: Big Daddy O

customer_reviews.title: Needs Lower Settings
customer_reviews.text: No hard feelings but this burner did not meet my expectations. #1 it does not have it's own igniter which is so cheap to install it is stupid not to have one and #2 the burner gas is incremented and not graduated meaning the lowest setting is too high for just warming food and even on the lowest setting is way too high to cook some things.
customer_reviews.author: Vulcan

customer_reviews.title: Money Well Spent
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little stove. I used it a 7,000' plus and it burns nice and blue at all levels of adjustment. Prospective customers should know two things, though. You won't want to pack this any further than from your rig to a sheltered, comfortable spot... yards away. Also, the design does is not impervious to strong winds nor does it indicate when the next step down will put out the flame. Personally, I'd like to see it packed in a rugged, flexible plastic box, maybe one with room for two cylinders, and good "from now on".
customer_reviews.author: Mark Koons

customer_reviews.title: Great Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: I love this little stove! Great for boiling water and making coffee (fast) paired with the  and for cooking in a small cast iron skillet. Perfect for car camping or a short backpack trip.
customer_reviews.author: mary obrien

customer_reviews.title: Suits my needs but use with caution.
customer_reviews.text: Stability is always an issue with these types of stoves regardless of what company manufacturers them. The included base for this gas stove will accommodate both styles of standard LP bottles however stability is compromised for the short more round bottles because it can only fit into the base about 3/8” . The tall bottles will fit all the way into the base but the circumference of the base is too small in relation to the hight of the bottle and excessive top weight. Always use caution when using any fire producing device!
customer_reviews.author: Jim Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good quality  item
customer_reviews.text: Ok make sure u read well this stove donot comes with gas tank ok is separely And without tank u have have a hard time Using it i bought a hose adapter to use with propane gas work amazingly Super strong material not heavy If u use for camping get the gas tank ok And have fun flame is super strong cooks fast gd price too
customer_reviews.author: julio

customer_reviews.title: Livesaver in Yellowstone
customer_reviews.text: We tent camped for a week in Yellowstone National Park. This was our primary source of fuel for our meals. We did most everything using this with a large dutch oven. We never ran out of propane. We have six in our family and even made hot cocoa and coffee daily. I would buy this again and recommend it highly!
customer_reviews.author: Carrigan M.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product for my dad. He had one in the past and loved it. The first one arrived and only worked on high. Because he is older and lives far from any UPS store, it was difficult for him to return so I just ordered another to be sent to him. The 2nd one only works on high and med, not low. 😡
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor flame control
customer_reviews.text: I found it impossible to control the flame adequately to set a temperature for a simmer. I could only set to very high or low and the flame would go out. Don't buy.
customer_reviews.author: Rohan

customer_reviews.title: Simple and It Works
customer_reviews.text: I keep this unit in my truck toolbox for emergencies and/or whenever I want to make a quick hot meal when traveling. It is simple and easy to use. Not exactly compact but it doesn't take up a lot of space. Wish that it came with some sort of protective container. You really can't go wrong with Coleman. I have Coleman grills that were purchased in 1972 and they still work great. This is a handy single burner.
customer_reviews.author: HenryR

customer_reviews.title: Best camping Companion
customer_reviews.text: I and my husband wanted something compact and easy to carry in the minivan for our camping trip. We got a minivan that's why needed a small stove and compact one. We got the Coleman fuel tanks fit perfectly without any issues. Feedback: To provide a cover/small zippable box to make it easy for travel. Otherwise you have to carry box which takes more space.
customer_reviews.author: Couponkay

customer_reviews.title: For an emergency or tailgate party it is a excellent little propane cylinder stove
customer_reviews.text: For an emergency or tailgate party it is a excellent little propane cylinder stove... the top is well made stainless steel with wind baffles, works well as a side stove top. Very impressed with the construction and the versatility of this cylinder stove. It is easy to set up and store away. Being a first responder I keep one in the trunk of my truck as a backup for search as rescue base camp back up stove... has come in very handy many times. This is my second one I bought for bug out bag for search rescue base ops. Love Colman products.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Carrington

customer_reviews.title: Rating quality Only
customer_reviews.text: This unit is well made. From China of course. But I still trust Coleman for quality outdoor products. I haven't tried it as I don't camp any more, I purchased it in the event of a power outage. I also purchased a dozen or so propane bottles, part of my prepping plan. I am trusting that it will work, if not shame on me.
customer_reviews.author: Allan J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect stove!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how I'd feel switching from my old Coleman stove to this style, but when my old stove finally bit the dust, I decided I wanted something smaller and simpler. I absolutely love it. I'm impressed at how solid it is. It did a great job, even on a windy day. It was easy to control the heat and all my food came out as good as I could have done at home. I wish I'd had this all along!
customer_reviews.author: Marcie Blaylock

customer_reviews.title: Happy With Purchase
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this to have available should we lose power for several days during hurricane season. I tried it out. It fits multiple sizes of pans. Heated the food in a short time. Easy to assemble and does not take much space to store. Fuel can be found a couple of canisters for $7.50 at the big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Rhoads

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice sturdy and has a nice flame easy pack in and out
customer_reviews.author: Benito camelo

customer_reviews.title: I've used it once, but it performed.
customer_reviews.text: I took this burner out on a camping trip and boiled water twice for prepackaged meals. It did what is was supposed to do. If you don't like to waste money on over-hyped expensive products like the Jet-Boil, this Coleman burner will "make hot stuff" just as well for a fraction of the price. Buying fuel is also much easier as you just have to find a local Walmart rather than ordering it online.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Schnipke

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping
customer_reviews.text: We used this for camping and it worked great. Much better than the generic cook set you might get at supermarkets that use cheap canisters of gas. The generic ones cannot withstand wind and you had to improvise to block wind from blowing out the fire . This one withstood wind like a charm, and matched with Coleman's green propane gas canisters, worked perfectly on our trip to Yellowstone national park in the 40 degree weather and high altitude (8000 Ft). By the way, the green propane canisters from Coleman will last 2 hours on high heat settings (10000 BTU).
customer_reviews.author: PP

customer_reviews.title: This stove is big and heavy and best suited for camping out of a car and not ...
customer_reviews.text: Camp stove works as advertised, I unfortunately purchased this when I first got in to backpacking without doing any research. This stove is big and heavy and best suited for camping out of a car and not out of a backpack. Works good tho
customer_reviews.author: SpoodleTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great for when the dual-burner is too big
customer_reviews.text: I love the Coleman dual-burner for car camping, but needed something smaller for hiking into a backcountry site. This worked perfectly - no problem at all cooking bacon, steaks, shrimp, etc in a 14" skillet. It's much more stable than it looks. My only wish is that the base and the burner 'nested' together to make them more packable. To be honest a little plastic carrying case would be nice. .
customer_reviews.author: Travis Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Needs tweeking
customer_reviews.text: For the most part this is a sturdy item, but mine has a wiggle to it, and the burner sits crooked. The plastic flame/fuel adjustment knob is cheap, and I couldn't keep my flame on a true low setting without it clicking off on its own. Needs better, more reliable control. I will be exchanging mine, hopefully for one that is not crooked and without wiggle. It did boil water quickly in my coffee percolator. ***Update*** Amazon sent me a replacement. The burner sits straight, and there's no wiggle in this new one making it very sturdy. If Coleman put a better regulating knob on it I would definitely give this 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Human1

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: I like this stove with the wind shield and heat adjustments. About 3 to 4 minutes and you will have boiling water. 10,000 btu makes camping a lot easier. Thus far I have cooked 4 spaghetti meals from one tank of fuel and the tank still has fuel left. I use the dump method of cooking the spaghetti. Draining the water, then dump the canned spaghetti sauce on top and cook until heated. I average about 10 minutes per meal cook time adjusting from high to low flame setting. I have found that if you use a 6 inch long piezo lighter it works better than the short piezo lighters.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky R Green

customer_reviews.title: Great single burner
customer_reviews.text: This is a great and strong single burner! When I got it I couldn't help but wonder how well this would work. I took 2 identical pots filled with 2 cups of water each and put one on my camp stove and the other on the kitchen range. The camp stove was boiling before the kitchen range! I've used it in high winds(some care and caution required here) and it performed extremely well. It's pretty dang stable with larger pots and pans on it, although sense dictated holding the handle while stirring things. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for car camping or catch 'n cooks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use when my girlfriend and I car camp or when I camp solo. Having a small backpacking style stove isn't always convenient, especially when it comes to stability. This propane bottle burner works great. It gets hot, is stable, and I like that it's fairly light weight (but still feels solid and well-mads). I think the heat adjustment could be tweaked to be more precise, but I have no other complaints. It still works great and I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Gruver

customer_reviews.title: Great setup
customer_reviews.text: I used this as my go to water boiling setup on a recent trip to the Northwest. For car/truck camping it is possible to put together quite a nice little brewing kit in a 5-gallon bucket with a seat-lid and be all set for your morning and evening coffee. "No regrets" purchase... fuel canisters readily available in a surprisingly high number of places.
customer_reviews.author: B. F.

customer_reviews.title: Great for quick and easy meals
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find anything easier to use. I gave four stars because it was hard to line up threads when putting it on the bottle. I had used the bottle on my old stove with no issues. We'll see if problem continues. Functioned fine, once bottle was on. For simple meals or to boil water, it's a no brainer. I was on a five day solo car camping trip and only used my double burner stove once. A single burner was all I needed most times. My old stove konked out after I got home. I can't complain, it was twenty years of light use old. This Coleman is a replacement for the old one.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Impractical
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not meant for long backpacking trips. It might be good if you’re going out with the family and for some reason you want to cook one smallish pot of something, then sure! But it’s super heavy, large, and obnoxious. I accidentally dropped it from about two feet off the ground the the head on the gas pipe broke clean off. A maybe 2/10; would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Micah Coomer

customer_reviews.title: Unstable Camp Stove
customer_reviews.text: Couple of things about this stove I don't like. There is no windscreen for the stove flame. The stove is pretty unstable unless you are able to sit it on a flat concrete surface and even then the CG is pretty high so it easily tips over. Also the gas control valve is pretty flaky. Protrudes out quite a bit and could easily get broken off or damaged when carried in a back pack. No igniter. Other than that the price was right but there are better stoves available.
customer_reviews.author: benny

customer_reviews.title: Not your grandfather's stove
customer_reviews.text: This stove works OK. Somewhat disappointed in the quality. The burner is a very loose fit on the gas tube and the control knob is sloppy and feels like it could fall off at any moment. The threads for the securing the bottle are not quite right and it takes some effort to get the bottle started and tightened properly. My much cheaper similar stove has none of these issues. You don't always get what you pay for..
customer_reviews.author: Bobwhite

customer_reviews.title: A great propane stove!! Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This stove is AWESOME! It boils water fast! I would recommend this stove to any camper out there. I would recommend this stove to anyone as a backup for power outages and the like. No it’s not compact but that’s what makes it strong and will long lasting, you find the right pot pan combination and hikers can love it too.
customer_reviews.author: J. Mill

customer_reviews.title: great stove
customer_reviews.text: I almost bought a cheap knockoff to save a few bucks. I'm so glad I didn't. This one is worth a few extra bucks, if you can find it in stock. It's very well made, produces a steady even flame, and looks brand new after months of use.
customer_reviews.author: GunNut37086

customer_reviews.title: Perfect height
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning on using this while sitting on your cooler in your campsite, then this is the perfect height for cooking on. Obviously you need reasonably flat dirt to set it on, but that is most campsites. The only reason it got 4/5 stars was the lowest setting is still a touch too hot. When cooking something sensitive to high heat be sure to monitor it and remove it from the burner when it starts reaching critical temperature.
customer_reviews.author: keith naulty

customer_reviews.title: CA Power Outages
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product in response to the prolonged CA power outages. I have a magnetic induction stove that is electric. When the power went out, I couldn't cook. This little burner was enough, although it did not come with propane canisters. I had to order them separately.
customer_reviews.author: angela

customer_reviews.title: Pot holder supports are sturdily attached and of good weight of metal
customer_reviews.text: Typical well-made Coleman single burner stove. Pot holder supports are sturdily attached and of good weight of metal. Valve is well made, and the cylinder base is wide enough to provide reasonable stability. The perfect "emergency stove" for when you loose your power for a full day or multi days. The burner is adjustable from low to a high setting of 10K BTUs (that's a LOT of HEAT on high). The squat propane cylinders will supply over 20K BTUs of use, so that's cooking/heating lots of pots of water/soup/etc. As I said, an excellent emergency stove as well as being a camp stove.
customer_reviews.author: VT Opinion

customer_reviews.title: packing for storage not well thought out
customer_reviews.text: Review for Coleman PerfectFlow 1-Burner Stove. Uses 1lb propane cylinder This is an indirect criticism. The burner works fine and seems solid. Lots of heat output and apparently well made. The problem is storing it. If the design had been though out just a little bit better the plastic "stable base" would pack more closely with the burner-reflector assemble to make a smaller package. I may try cutting 4 slots in the base to allow that. It wouldn't be a big thing. The alternate might be to have some form of fold-up feet that would allow the base to pack inside the reflector. You can buy aftermarket "stable bases" that have swivel feet to reduce the diameter for storage.
customer_reviews.author: siliconhillbilly

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Stove
customer_reviews.text: Went tent camping for 2019 Oshkosk air show and needed a little camp stove. Didn't disappoint. Very easy to set up, great heating ability, stable with my cast iron pan. Gas consumption as expected. Don't forget to use the plastic base to stabilize the stove while in use.
customer_reviews.author: We are Normal

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect! Would buy again!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for car camping while hunting. I have a super small one I use for hiking, but wanted something larger that uses 100% propane. I was amazed how fast it heated a can of soup (less than 5 min). Very well built! I do wish it had an igniter, but not a deal breaker. Will definitely take it camping in the summer with our camper so we can cook outside.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: If you wanted fine control over low flame, you will have to void the warranty to get it with this one.
customer_reviews.text: It is inexpensive, and not super bulky. But I bought a propane unit for the fine control of low flame, for real cooking. This unit, idiotically, has detents that bypass the whole low flame zone. I figured out I can bypass the detents by pressing the knob down. So I will be making some kind of device to keep the knob pressed down just the right amount so the control knob can turn off, but has no clicks.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Not for backpacking.
customer_reviews.text: MUST HAVE COFFEE! Absolutely the one thing I must have when I crawl out of the sleeping bag. Don't want it to be a lot of trouble either. This stove is perfect for me. I steered away from the more expensive stoves mostly because I didn't want to have trouble finding the right fuel. This stove uses the 16.4 oz.. propane tanks that can be found anywhere that sells camping supplies. It is much larger than I was expecting so I would not recommend it for backpacking. I only do car camping so not an issue for me. Overall very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: B. Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Avid camper, this holds up
customer_reviews.text: Took this to many national parks and its made it through rain, mud, 110 degree heat, and freezing nights. This guy has done its job nicely since I've had it. Big recommendation for convenience. Works pretty well for backpacking, but would recommend mainly for long-term camping trips.
customer_reviews.author: Francis Chino

customer_reviews.title: Coleman is great.
customer_reviews.text: I don't mind getting something that was previously returned, because I appreciate Amazon s liberal return policy, but they should cover the previous label. That's advice to Amazon. Having said that it was pristine, and worked perfectly. And it delivered earlier than expected.
customer_reviews.author: crusty old dog

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy quality
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a previous Coleman canister-top stove which I used for many years but had some design flaws. This product is heavy and solid which is important when you're holding hot food and liquids. It seems a bit expensive for such a simple device which keeps it at a 4-star rating for me. On the other hand turning a simple propane bottle into a stove or heater is pretty cool. Buy quality and cry once, right?
customer_reviews.author: Willard

customer_reviews.title: Great for travelling!
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these on Prime Day for an upcoming camping trip to Canada - this was small and easy to fit into my checked luggage. Can really get water heated quickly - I found (1) Coleman canister was enough for our whole group (6 people) for the weekend. Great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Conrad

customer_reviews.title: Hard to adjust to low heat setting.
customer_reviews.text: The quality seems fine, but it's really hard to adjust this burner to low. It seems to start at medium high and go up from there. Great for boiling water, not great for cooking pancakes.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: the old version was better
customer_reviews.text: I have an older version with a smooth-turning knob that lets me adjust the flame exactly how I want it. This one inexplicably has a knob with pre-set stops! Either the flame is too high, or too low. I cannot fathom this. I am saving it for an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Heem

customer_reviews.title: practical
customer_reviews.text: I don't do much camping :but when I do is a great camping piece. Stable >My main concern is hurricane season .I have an electric stove .It will do not good during and electric outage. good stove to have ,small ,doesn't need much space to put it away.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Litteken

customer_reviews.title: The best little burner.
customer_reviews.text: I borrowed one first for a camp-out and fell in love with it. The burner is easy to transport, dismantle. The burner is quite steady even without a wind screen. I make lots of tea, cook gourmet and the propane seems to last forever! At least a week. Perfect for one on the road/camp/hike/walk-about. I use an old mouse-sander bag for the whole stove set-up with propane, potholders, lighters, foil and cooking spray. For more people it would provide a great extra burner along a regular two-burner camp-stove, of which I have used many, but none of them were as handy this.
customer_reviews.author: Gypsy chef

customer_reviews.title: Great for seasoning smaller pans and searing
customer_reviews.text: I have looking for a burner I can use outside since I do not cook with a gas cooktop. I am using this product to season pans and to sear meats and fish. It works great. The is just what the doctor ordered. The gas valve control for different heat settings works well. Two things I would like to see as far as improvements are a piezo lighter and wider burner. More than a 10” pan is pushing the boundaries of balance on the burner
customer_reviews.author: David DiPasquale

customer_reviews.title: Best Propane Stove
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought a Primus stove and canisters for my earthquake kit. I have since found out that the Coleman stove is much more versatile. Also the Coleman propane fuel canisters are MUCH more available and much CHEAPER! I have used this camp stove with a 16oz/ propane bottle in conjunction with a lightweight boy scout aluminum cook set and it has lasted me more than a week. This product is great. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: goody99

customer_reviews.title: Don’t use the electro stove. Use this instead!
customer_reviews.text: I use it to fry fish outside to avoid stinking up the house. I also use it to make Greek coffee. Makes the coffee in seconds on the Greek briki. Helps avoid using the electric stove for making Greek coffee. Excellent product. I fully recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Happy Camper 😊
customer_reviews.text: Lol neat little thing, I bought it for my boyfriend and he loves it. I can't really give too much detail since it was bought for him but I do remember someone saying to buy propane bottles at walmart ,which we did its cheaper than ordering on here. We also bought small cookware at are local Walmart ( 9 inch- I think) the instructions say 7 or 8 inch but it worked fine cooking hotdogs.
customer_reviews.author: JDP83

customer_reviews.title: it can easily hold a medium
customer_reviews.text: I only wanted something to boil water for coffee in the morning during camping trips. This is far sturdier than it appears. If you wanted to, it can easily hold a medium, or even a large frying pan if you wanted to make eggs or pancakes in the morning. Much easier to use than the dual burner one. The only problem is, it does not have a wind guard. But that can be easily remedied if you place it behind your tent and use it there. So far, I love it, and Im happy I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: W. Moran

customer_reviews.title: came apart!
customer_reviews.text: Got one of these burners and loved it. very powerful. Got a second one and the parts in the middle of the burner all came apart. even after putting it together. not safe so i discontinued using one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio

customer_reviews.title: It's A Coleman
customer_reviews.text: Quality, and sturdiness. It breaks apart to fit in my cooking tote while camping, along with a 1 lb propane bottle. Food heats quickly, it's steady. I was afraid of tipping, but the base holds the propane bottle steady and upright. Great work Coleman!
customer_reviews.author: M. Fabian

customer_reviews.title: This burner worked great. It did will in the rain
customer_reviews.text: This burner worked great. It did will in the rain, and handled a moderate breeze. The base provides good balance, and the flame controls worked well. It does NOT have a piezo ignition, so it does require matches to light. Cons: -- Larger and more awkward than I expected. It does not pack that well, and it is too large to be suitable for backpacking. This is great for car camping. -- The spacing of the pot supports is wide so small items like cans or coffee cups will not sit on the burning. You would need another grill to lay above the flame to support these items.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Bolt

customer_reviews.title: Great stove!
customer_reviews.text: Not really for backpacking, but I have a huge 90 liter bag, so I don't mind. Using this over hybrid fuel stoves lets you not worry about conserving fuel. I used it constantly for a weekend trip and couldn't be happier. If you are NOT backpacking (ie. car camping, day picnic, etc), this stove has no flaws, just buy it. If you are considering this for backpacking, understand it is on the bulky side and doesn't collapse or anything. For me personally, it wasn't a weight issue, just finding a way to pack it well. The advantages of this over a tiny, fold-able backpackers stove are: Immensely better at standing upright, and longer burn time
customer_reviews.author: macman

customer_reviews.title: Compact and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my emergency supplies and love that it uses the Coleman bottle. It is compact and easy to store in a 72 hour emergency kit. The propane canisters are easy to find (I get mine at Walmart) and to store. This is a great addition to camping or emergency prep storage.
customer_reviews.author: Atka's Mom

customer_reviews.title: ... used this on 2 trips now and it works great! I've made spaghetti
customer_reviews.text: I have used this on 2 trips now and it works great! I've made spaghetti, tacos, coffee, mac and cheese, and hamburgers and everything turned out great. Fuel adjustment stays where you put it and it has a spot to install a push button igniter as well. Ill be adding that in near future just to add a little convenience. It is a little clunky if you're packing for a hiking trip. The valve tends to take up a good bit of space in my pack, but thats just hiking. For camping, fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: crustykeeb

customer_reviews.title: All or nothing
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I’m doing it wrong but it seems like the settings are all or nothing. Now, “all” does work well normally for my set up but I would like a little more control. The problem is the knob is set to different “clicks” as settings instead of a smooth and gradual opening and closing (like a gas stove at home). Besides that, the quality is solid and it has been super reliable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Z

customer_reviews.title: Great for small pots/pans lightweight very portable
customer_reviews.text: I had never personally used a camp stove but this was very easy to use. And as long as you don’t try to use a pot or pan that is too big it will cook evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Becky S

customer_reviews.title: No fuel
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I bought this in a hurry, with a working bearing down on me, and didn't realize that it did not come with the fuel, which is the part I really needed. I don't know if the ad did not specifically say that, or if I assumed based on photo. So I returned it unused. So I really can't rate...
customer_reviews.author: Crtclthinkr

customer_reviews.title: Burner was broke upon recieving
customer_reviews.text: While my luck with this wasn't the best, I think I got a defect that wasn't necessarily colemans fault and through warranty, they made it right. Props to Coleman.
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: Have brought this along on a few hikes/camping excursions and it has done a stellar job each time. It distributes the flame/heat evenly. It's not too heavy, although it is a bit bulky and maybe not recommended for backpackers. It does hold camping style pots/pans perfectly with no fear of tipping or strain. Glad i bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Williams

customer_reviews.title: Must have for a camp cooking.
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this product.. if you are camping and you want to have a good meal in the morning or lunch, like eggs, bacon, beans etc. you can easily do it. This has been a lifesaver for us to eat some hot food and boil milk for our toddler and numerous amount of time teas we made. I am glad that my wife found this product.
customer_reviews.author: Nadar

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel stove
customer_reviews.text: Nice compact stove we purchased this for use while traveling on a motorcycle..the beuty of this is it uses reg size popane bottles not this fancy back pack gas sterno cans ...would be way to heavy to use on backpacking unless your going close..
customer_reviews.author: DON SHOEMAKER

customer_reviews.title: great stove
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect quick alternative to a big stove of having to start a campfire for heat. Also of great use when camping sites have a fire restriction. Very portable and easy to use. Wish I would have purchased this sooner!
customer_reviews.author: nj

customer_reviews.title: Great value and product.
customer_reviews.text: Boy does this heat my cast iron skillet fast. I use this on my patio to cook steaks and burgers. I highly recommend this little guy for outdoor cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I was absolutely thrilled when I first used this. Our campfire took 20 minutes or more to boil water. This had water at a rolling boiling in 5
customer_reviews.author: Cole Walters

customer_reviews.title: Coleman is a hit!
customer_reviews.text: As always the Coleman name lived up to the brand! Excellent compact lightweight burner for single person to enjoy the comforts of a hot meal or cup of coffee with or the hassle of a fire! My only complaint is that..in my own opinion would have been nice to include some linings of carrying case to secure it and protect it during transport or backpacking
customer_reviews.author: jo marcum

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This little cooking burner was perfect! More stable than I thought it would be. Even with a medium size pan on it. It heated up water quicker than my Keurig at home. I would definitely recommend and goodbye again.
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: serious piece of hardware
customer_reviews.text: heavier duty then expected. top is all steel and not thin. nice for focusing the heat and some wind protection. great stove for car camping or with groups. not really any difference to a home gas burner for cooking. I also got a cheaper stove that folds up so small it can fit in my pocket. That is the one I'd probably take for when solo camping and packing lite. shipped super fast - ordered on friday and arrived on sunday
customer_reviews.author: FrogsOnTheRun

customer_reviews.title: Very powerful camping burner
customer_reviews.text: This is a very powerful camping burner to use with the propane tanks. It is great for any cooking and the large surface area means it can hold a large pot or pan very well. It is not compact for backpacking, but as a campsite burner it is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Guyler

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little camp stove
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for a trip to Yellowstone and the Tetons this fall because we didn't want to bring our two burner camp stove. It was awesome! It's light weight and compact. It heated up our food items and water quickly and could be used on the tailgate of the truck or at a picnic table in a rest area. Would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase !
customer_reviews.text: This little stove exceeded my expectations! I wish I bought another one so I had more than one stove. We went camping for two weeks and loved how compact it gets. Super easy to connect to propane tank.would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Belale

customer_reviews.title: Great for fishing trips
customer_reviews.text: Every year I go on a couple backpacking camping trip. I already had one, but my son is starting to go with me so I needed a second one. I like that they are fairly light and fit in my pack well. With the base they support a medium to large fry pan well.
customer_reviews.author: Giles

customer_reviews.title: Functional Burner
customer_reviews.text: Love how small it is. The plastic base could be more stable, but overall a good product for 1-2 eaters/drinkers. It took about 10-12 minutes at 9k feet to heat a full sized tea kettle. I was impressed with this. Buy a solid, small cook set and this is all you’ll need!
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy.
customer_reviews.text: Valve actually shuts completely off! Very stable bottle base. Light and easy to pack. Get it now.
customer_reviews.author: Bootney Lee Farnsworth

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Live neer Charleston SC And when the power goes out witch it doesn't do very offton but when a bad storm comes in from the sea for the few days you are with out power you need to cook.This does the job and when not in use it is easy to store. It also fits in your bug out bag. I bought this one for me.
customer_reviews.author: Boats D.Lyle

customer_reviews.title: Convenience
customer_reviews.text: I used this product for our very first camping. I knew that I wasn’t gonna deal with making fire early in the morning so I purchased this portable stove and it was great. Just light it up and and your morning coffee is ready in 5 min. However it is not ideal for backpacking because it’s a little heavy.
customer_reviews.author: ahmet

customer_reviews.title: Good but not great
customer_reviews.text: Product works as expected for car camping although would have preferred it to be more stable. Also the cooking surface is slightly off angle/tilted which means you can not fill cooking pot/cup as much as I would like. A very small issue. Good value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Dbetancourt

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Puts out high heat, works great even when its windy, and most of all it holds large heavy pots so you can cook for more than one person at a time. I keep this stove in my pack while fishing for catch and cook afternoons
customer_reviews.author: Dave Spangler

customer_reviews.title: Item did not come in original packaging just thrown into the box.
customer_reviews.text: I received the stove like this. Not in the original manufacturers box so I have no idea if this item has been used or is damaged or not. I would of like to have the original box sealed like I paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter98926

customer_reviews.title: Hot burner!
customer_reviews.text: Very high output. Easy to light and flame control is decent. Kind of hard to line up with cylinder to screw in but I think that's more the 1" engineering specs. I have trouble screwing in some 1" hoses. Anyway this stove is sturdy, good sized and well made . Should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: JKBinVA

customer_reviews.title: Simmer and Boil in the Great Outdoors
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased 2 of these for our base camp - one for cooking pasta while the other was cooking meat and veggies. These burners are built heavy and strong. The stove is nice and sturdy and is able to simmer as well as it can boil water. And let me tell you, this boiled water very quickly (with the lid on). I was quite impressed! I used to use only my charcoal grill which left us waiting a while for our meal. Now, we eat in no time after a long day of hiking. If you're looking to backpack with this, I would definitely look elsewhere due to the weight. However, for your family base camp, this is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: B. Hare

customer_reviews.title: For use around the house, or emergency camping.
customer_reviews.text: I have this, plus extra propane canisters it fits, for emergency use in my home, or because of its size, it can fit in my bug out bag if it is necessary to leave our house. It is smaller and lighter then my two burner Coleman stove.
customer_reviews.author: John Fouquette

customer_reviews.title: Have used these for years. They are great to have.
customer_reviews.text: I love the Coleman portable stoves. We have used these for camping and for power outages to cook with!! I moved and misplaced my last one, so I was very happy to get another for when needed!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Simple camp stove that works great
customer_reviews.text: Boils water quickly and breaks down nicely. You need a lighter to light it. Not a big deal. I use it for camping and also to heat straighten bamboo.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Sea

product_meta.title: Coleman Gas Camping Stove | Bottletop Propane Stove, 1 Burner
product_meta.description:
Looking for a compact stove to take on the trail? Look no further than the Coleman Bottletop Propane Gas Camping Stove. Its cooking surface fits an 8-inch pan above a fully adjustable burner that delivers up to 10,000 total BTUs of cooking power. When you’re ready to head home, the burner and base easily separate from the propane bottle for compact packing.

AMAZON.COM
The Coleman 5431A700 One-burner Propane Stove is an easy-to-use portable stove that should meet almost any camp cooking need. The PerfectFlow regulator provides consistent cooking performance by producing a steady fuel stream, even in cold weather, high altitudes, or when fuel is low. Equipped with one 10,000 BTU burner, this fully adjustable stove will last for 2.2 hours on high or up to nine hours on low.

 The pot supports help shield your cooking flame from the wind, while the large eight-inch burner bowl should fit most any pot. This Coleman one-burner stove can boil a quart of water in just four minutes! This stove operates on one 16.4-ounce cylinder of Coleman propane (not included).

 Manufacturer Warranty
Limited lifetime warranty
feature_bullets: COOKING POWER: Up to 10,000 total BTUs
PRESSURE REGULATOR: Pressure control for consistent performance, even in extreme conditions
PERFECTHEAT DESIGN: More efficient cooking with less fuel
1 ADJUSTABLE BURNER: For precise temperature control; fits an 8 in. pan
WIND BAFFLES: Shield burner from wind for maximum heat
SPACE SAVER: Burner and base separate from propane bottle for compact storage
RUNTIME: Up to 2.5 hours on high on one 16.4 oz. propane cylinder (sold separately)

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
